questions.question_text: Which API method is used to create objects or overwrite existing ones?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is correct. Set creates or overwrites existing objects

Selected Answer: A
Method: set
Description: This method updates an existing object or creates it if it doesn't exist.

Selected Answer: A
A is correct
Pay attention "Add" method does not overwrite, but just creates objects
FMG 7.4 Administrator Study Guide

Selected Answer: B
B is correct
FMG 7.4 Administrator Study Guide

choices.B: The primary unit synchronizes all configuration revision with the secondary units.
choices.D: Each cluster member must be upgraded manually, starting with the primary unit.
choices.C: All secondary units must be in the same network as the primary unit.
choices.A: When a secondary unit is removed, FortiManager updates the managed devices using TCP port 5199.

questions.question_text: What is a characteristic of the FortiManager high availability (HA) feature?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
Correct Answer: A & D.
FortiManager 7.4 Administrator Study Guide

Selected Answer: AD
A,D
Study guide

Selected Answer: AD
A&D are correct

questions.question_text: Which two items are included in the FortiManager backup? (Choose two.)
Which two statements about Security Fabric integration with FortiManager are true? (Choose two.)

choices.B: The Security Fabric settings are part of the device-level settings.
choices.D: The Security Fabric license, group name, and password are required for the FortiManager Security Fabric integration.
choices.C: The Fabric View module enables you to view the Security Fabric ratings for Security Fabric devices.
choices.A: The Fabric View module enables you to generate the Security Fabric ratings for Security Fabric devices.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
B&C are correct

questions.question_text:
An administrator has assigned a global policy package to a new ADOM called ADOM1.
What will happen if the administrator tries to create a new policy package in ADOM1?

choices.A: When creating a new policy package, the administrator can select the option to assign the global policy package to the new policy package.
choices.B: When a new policy package is created, the administrator must assign the global policy package from the global ADOM.
choices.C: When a new policy package is created, the administrator must import the global policy package to ADOM1.
choices.D: When the new policy package is created, FortiManager automatically assigns the global policy package to the new policy package.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
first, this answer conflict with another question earlier.
and I just performed a quick lab, it will automatically added to new policy package. (in fact, also auto added to existing policy package as well)

Selected Answer: D
I will go for D
Supposing when the global pp is assigned to ADOM, the default option assign to all PP in the ADOM is let checked.
